channel.title: Css
channel.description: Hey guys, does anybody know of any really good a thorough CSS tutorial. I've looked at like 10 and none of them make much sense to me. I'm just kind of going through the motions and not learning it. I've looked around and can't find a REALLY good tutorial. Does anybody know of any?

item.title: Css
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:8, topic:523854”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=642399.msg4326662#msg4326662 date=1373051325]

[quote author=Arcik link=topic=642399.msg4326656#msg4326656 date=1373050321]
You don’t need tutorials to learn css
http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/propidx.html
Only a retard won’t understand what background-color does, but if you really get confused then just google it

All you need to do is learn the syntax
[/quote]There’s more to writing good CSS than just knowing the syntax. Architecture and design are pretty important if you’re going to try to write something serious.
[/quote]Once he learns the bases, he’ll eventually just naturally pickup everything else.

Design and architecture is followed by like every programming language.[/quote]You can pick up a lot of bad habits with CSS. It isn’t just something you naturally pick up while using it, there are tons of pitfalls and it’s good to learn how to use it properly once you’ve got the basics covered.

Read full topic

item.title: Css
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:7, topic:523854”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=642399.msg4326656#msg4326656 date=1373050321]
You don’t need tutorials to learn css
http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/propidx.html
Only a retard won’t understand what background-color does, but if you really get confused then just google it

All you need to do is learn the syntax
[/quote]There’s more to writing good CSS than just knowing the syntax. Architecture and design are pretty important if you’re going to try to write something serious.[/quote]

CSS has advance selectors and CSS3 has programming abilities and he’s only starting off. Do you think he’s gonna get far ahead at an early stage? Once he learns the bases, he’ll eventually just naturally pickup everything else.

Design and architecture is followed by like every programming language.

Read full topic

item.title: Css
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

You don’t need tutorials to learn css
http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/propidx.html https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS3
Only a retard won’t understand what background-color does, but if you really get confused then just google it

All you need to do is learn the syntax

Read full topic

http://www.w3schools.com/css/

stick to the web design section please
[/quote]
This is the General Programming section. Any language can be discussed.[/quote]any programming language can be, yes

css is a stylesheet generally used in web development. it should go there.

item.title: Css
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Well once you’ve got the basics down, look into SMACSS and OOCSS. Watch some videos (and blogs) by Nicole Sullivan, Harry Roberts and Nicolas Gallagher.

[quote=“Vain_, post:2, topic:523854”]http://www.w3schools.com/css/[/quote]I wouldn’t recommend W3Schools.

EDIT:
Looks like the MDN has a beginner’s tutorial as well.

MDN Web Docs

Introduction to CSS

CSS is used to style and lay out web pages — for example, to alter the font, colour, size and spacing of your content, split it into multiple columns, or add animations and other decorative features. This module gets you started on the path to CSS...

Read full topic
